channel.title: Bloomberg Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Trump Says TikTok Buyer Group Found, Needs China Nod
item.description: President Donald Trump said he has identified a buyer for the US operations of TikTok, the social media app owned by Chinese company ByteDance Ltd., without naming the winning bidder.
item.dc:creator: Hadriana Lowenkron, Maria Paula Mijares Torres

media:content.media:description: The TikTok app page in the Google Play store on a smartphone arranged in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Wednesday, Jan. 15, 2025. The Supreme Court signaled it's likely to uphold a law that would ban the popular TikTok social media platform in the US if it isn't sold by its Chinese parent company by Jan. 19.

item.title: Oaktree Co-CEO Panossian Sees Signs of Exuberance in Data Center Boom
item.description: The amount of money chasing investments linked to artificial intelligence is creating the “risk of excesses,” said Armen Panossian, co-Chief Executive Officer at Oaktree Capital Management LP.
item.dc:creator: Neil Callanan, Francine Lacqua

media:content.media:description: Armen Panossian, co-chief executive officer of Oaktree Capital Management LP, during a Bloomberg Television interview in London.

item.title: Delhi Developer to Invest $2 Billion on India Data Center Boom
item.description: Anant Raj Ltd. plans to spend 180 billion rupees ($2.1 billion) on data centers as it joins a growing list of Indian companies looking to ride the boom in demand for artificial intelligence and business process-led services in the country.
item.dc:creator: Apoorva Ajith

item.title: China Shows Off Tech Resilience in Face of Trump Export Controls
item.description: As Donald Trump brandishes US export controls on technology as a bargaining chip to wrest supplies of rare earth magnets from Beijing, China is showcasing what it can do without the most advanced American semiconductors.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Fran Wang, Lucille Liu

item.title: The UK’s Record-Breaking Sunshine Isn’t All Good News
item.description: One of Britain’s warmest — and sunniest — springs ever may be lifting spirits, but it comes with challenges.
item.dc:creator: Lara Williams

item.title: Stablecoin Frenzy Fuels Steep Stock Gains That Make Funds Wary
item.description: Some investors are growing wary over the global stablecoin craze that has driven massive gains in shares of companies linked to the still-emerging technology.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang, Sangmi Cha

item.title: Chinese Robot Startup Reaps Rewards After High-Profile Race
item.description: Just a few months ago, Noetix Robotics was struggling to find a single customer for its Hobbit-sized robots. Founder Jiang Zheyuan was nervous about burning through investors’ money quickly. Then one of its N2 models placed second in the world’s first half-marathon for robots.
item.dc:creator: Biyun Song, Zheping Huang, Annabelle Droulers

media:content.media:description: The Noetix N2 robot after the Beijing E-Town half-marathon in April 2025. Photographer: Li He/Xinhua/Getty Images

item.title: NTT’s $812 Million REIT Float Set to Break Singapore IPO Drought
item.description: Japan’s NTT Ltd. is seeking to raise as much as $812 million in a Singapore listing of its data center real estate investment trust, in what is poised to be the city-state’s biggest IPO in eight years.
item.dc:creator: John Cheng

item.title: Key Senators Strike Deal To Pause State AI Laws For Five Years
item.description: The Senate is poised to approve a controversial provision preventing some US states from regulating artificial intelligence, marking a victory for the tech companies, venture capital firms and startups that backed it.
item.dc:creator: Oma Seddiq, Emily Birnbaum

item.title: Apple Supplier Lens Tech Seeks Up to $606 Million in HK Listing
item.description: Lens Technology Co., a supplier to Apple Inc., is seeking to raise as much as HK$4.8 billion ($606 million) in a Hong Kong listing, the latest Chinese company to seek a second trading foothold in the financial hub.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti

media:content.media:description: A shop assistant serves a customer inside the Apple Inc. Sanlitun store in Beijing, China, on Friday, Sept. 20, 2024. Apple launched the iPhone 16 lineup in almost 60 countries on Friday. But the device won’t come installed with Apple Intelligence — the much-anticipated AI software that the company has been touting since June.

item.title: Australia Startups Starved of Cash Despite Big Potential Returns
item.description: Australian startups lag far behind the US and China in funding raised despite the country’s historical effectiveness at creating unicorns.
item.dc:creator: Benicia Tan

item.title: Apple Should Sell a Smart Ring to Expand Its Fitness Tracker Lineup
item.description: Apple should seriously consider developing a smart ring to give its fitness-tracking wearables push new momentum and widen its market. Also: The company hints at a tethered Vision Pro, and there are new beta versions of iOS 26 and other operating systems.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

item.title: Fist-Pumping Humanoid Robots Play Soccer Badly in Beijing
item.description: They looked like tipsy 7-year-olds stumbling about the soccer pitch. But the game that unfolded at an industrial zone in Beijing was a breakthrough for humanoid robots and the artificial intelligence that powered them through a 5-3 match on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Saritha Rai

media:content.media:description: BEIJING, CHINA - JUNE 28: Humanoid robot football players compete in the match between Shanhai team of China Agricultural University and Tsinghua Hephaestus Team from Tsinghua University during the inaugural domestic 3v3 AI-powered robot football match, the first test event of the 2025 World Humanoid Robot Games, on June 28, 2025 in Beijing, China. This is a competition with zero human remote control, where robots make fully autonomous decisions and demonstrate intelligent communication and teamwork. (Photo by Zhang Xiangyi/China News Service/VCG via AP )

item.title: DOJ Settles Merger Case Over HPE’s $13 Billion Juniper Deal
item.description: The Justice Department settled its lawsuit challenging Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s $13 billion takeover of Juniper Networks, less than two weeks before a trial was set to start.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco

media:content.media:description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise headquarters in Spring, Texas, US, on Monday, May 29, 2023. Hewlett Packard Enterprise is scheduled to release earnings figures on June 1.

item.title: Meta Taps Four OpenAI Researchers for Superintelligence Team
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. has hired four notable artificial intelligence researchers from OpenAI, ramping up a hiring spree for its Superintelligence group.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman, Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: Meta headquarters in Menlo Park, California, US, on Tuesday, Jan 28, 2025. Meta Platforms Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on January 29. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Canada Orders Hikvision to Cease Local Operations
item.description: Canadian Industry Minister Melanie Joly said her government ordered Hikvision Canada to cease all operations in the country and close its business.
item.dc:creator: Yi Wei Wong

media:content.media:description: Surveillance cameras manufactured by Hangzhou Hikvision Digital Technology Co. are mounted on a post at a testing station near the company's headquarters in Hangzhou, China, on Tuesday, May 28, 2019. Hikvision, which is controlled by the Chinese government, is one of the leaders in the market for surveillance technology, with cameras that can produce sharp, full-color images in fog and near-total darkness. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg
